title: Amritsar  Jewel of the Crown
text:
Travel Articles | July 27, 2015 
Amritsar: historically also known as Ramdaspur and colloquially as Ambarsar, is a city in north-western part in India and the administrative headquarters of the Amritsar district in the state of Punjab. 
Amritsar, the Golden City of Punjab as it homes the Harmandir Sahib worldwide known as Golden Temple.The name of the city is anciently derived from the name the holy water of the lake named as AmritSarovar means the lake of Nectar. It is the water that flows around the Golden Temple and covers it. The lake is believed to be the holiest water of the state that washes all the sins away. 
That is why the city of Amritsar is known as the Spiritual Capital of the Indian state of Punjab. Amritsar is the most popular city in India for the non-resident Indians (NRI). The city is also known as Ramdaspur and it is referred to as Ambarsar.The city is well known for the JallianwalaBagh massacre held in 1919during the presidency of British Empire. Sri Guru Ram Das Jee International airport is the prime mote of arrival at The Golden City - Amritsar. 
Attractions of Amritsar 
The city has a number of auspicious and tremendous tourist attractions that allures thousands of domestic and international explorers. The jewel attractions of the city of Amritsar include: The Golden Temple, JallianwalaBagh, Akal Takht, Durgiana Temple, Wagah Border Ceremony and Summer Palace of Maharaja Ranjit Singh. 
Climate of Amritsar 
The city features a typical climate as the other cities of Northwestern of the country of India. The city experiences four seasons firstly winter season from the month of December to March then second is summer season which stays from the month of April to June after the hot summer it’s time for the climate to move towards monsoon which is the love season and stays from the month of July to September and post monsoon from October to November. 
Culture of Amritsar 
The city features a holistic and rich heritage of culture. It exhibits a spiritual and courageousculture influenced by the number of Shrines, temples and Gurudwaras and the Bravery of Sikh army that contribute a number of daring soldiers to the Indian Army. The city celebrates numerous festivals whole year but the main festivals celebrated at a wide level are Lohri, Vaisakhi and Holi. 
Cuisine of Amritsar 
As we all know that the State of Punjab is and the people of Punjab that is Punjabis are well known or the spicy and the tastiest food ever. The corn flour pancakes and the dishes being ready with mustard leaves and stems locally known as Makkiki Roti and SarsokaSaag is the favourite and symbolizing meal of the state of Punjab. The Ideal beverage of the state is a glass full of Lassi made from curd. Lassi is usually taken with the ideal meal and the Punjabis are fond of this meal. 
Specialty of Amritsar 
The area occupied by the city of Amritsar is called Majha which is meant as the Heartland and the city of Amritsar always being center staged in the region of Majha so the district is further known as the Mukut Mani, The jewel of the crown. The city is also known as the heartbeat of Majha region. The people from the city called Punjabis and are announced as the most successful community of the province of Punjab.
